Title: [CVS Core] Consider file contents in comparisons option sends too much binary data
description: This bug came up while looking at Bug 31453. When this option is on, file data is sent from the server to the client during a synchronize. While the data transfer is required for the function to work, this will have an undesired effect on slow links and large binary files. There are a number of options that could be implemented. 1) Leave it alone. The user should turn it off if they don't want the feature. 2) Don't apply this option to binary files. IE File contents for binary files are never considered. 3) Don't apply this option to "large" files. (We can either hard code what "large" is or let the user specify a size). 4) Remove this option since it seems unecessary since commit will not commit a file whoes contents have not changed.

Title: structuring managing 3.0 plugins
description:
As we move towards RCP the "platform" becomes harder to define.  For example, 
looking at the UI RCP proposal, much of the function now lumped together in the 
constellation of UI plugins will be made separable and more independent.  With 
this will come the need/desire to have some but not the others.  The same is 
true of things like Resources, Help, Search, ...

Currently the unit of install/update is the feature.  In going forward with the 
factoring, we also have to consider how that will play in the feature world.  
Having a very low plugin:feature  ratio is disappointing as the aggregation or 
grouping power of features is reduced/ignored.  However, the current 
update/install story does not allow the same plugin to be mentioned in multiple 
features in the same feature "requires" graph.  I don't fully recall the 
reasoning for this but sense it had to do with product service and support 
issues.

I am not proposing anything specific.  Rather I just wanted to raise the issue 
and make people aware that it will ave to be addressed.  I suspect we should 
have story by about M4.

Title: Doc: Change default value for "match" attribute of included features
description:
In the past, 'include' element did not have 'match' attribute. Therefore, all 
included features were looked for using the exact ID and version 
(a.k.a. 'perfect'). When we introduced the 'match' attribute, we wanted to 
preserve backward compatibility, so features without 'match' are considered to 
have match="perfect". This is different from the defaults for 'match' 
attribute when appearing in 'requires' element in both plugins and features. 
We have this well documented but people normally count on the analogy without 
reading the doc.

Since this is a common source of confusion, we may switch to 'compatible' 
being the default in 3.0, where we have more freedom for breaking changes.
	
So, the request is to change the default value for the 'match' attribute of 
the 'include' element from 'perfect' to 'compatible'.

Title: [syntax highlighting] Add support for line continuation to SingleLineRule and EndOfLineRule
description:
The classes SingleLineRule and EndOfLineRule in the org.eclipse.jface.text.rules
package should support line continuation. For example, some languages (Python,
to name one) support continuation of strings over multiple lines by using the
backslash as a line continuation character. C/C++, on the other hand allows the

Title: [Team Concurrency] Refactor getAllOutOfSync to support concurreny
description:
The getAllOutofSync of CVSWorkspaceSubscriber (and others) traverses the 
workspace and then returns the out-of-sync children. This has two problems:

1) If errors occur and exception is thrown and no SyncInfo are returned
2) The operation must complete before anything can be shown

These problems could be fixed by passing in a callback interface to the 
operation that can be invokded for each found SyncInfo. The callback could 
immediately create an Event and pass it to the sync view populating job so 
that the user can start seeing out-of-sync resources earlier. Also, the 
calback could have a second method for indicating an error on a particular 
resource.

Title: Configurator and Update.core
description:
While trying to call the reconciler from the configurator, one thing stroke me:
Why the configurator is not update.core?

For now what happens is the following:
  - the configurator starts, the PlatformConfiguration is used to find a .cfg 
file or to create a new configuration. If a new configuration is being created 
the reconciler becomes the application to start. 
When the reconciler is running, the PlatformConfiguration is again used to find 
a .cfg, etc, etc. and also creates platform.cfg.metadata stuffs.

Basically if we run the reconciler, the same work is done twice, and if we do 
not run the reconciler the .cfg and some other infos are missing.

So it seems to me that the configurator should be the reconciler part of 
update.core. This would allow to move into update the PlatformConfiguration API.
This update.core would also have to talk to the framework to install the 
bundles.

Title: In infocenter standalone modes, tocView.jsp nav images fail Web Accessibility checklist for checkpoint 1
description: When running the help system in infocenter or standalone help modes, it is running as a Web application. Web applications fall under the Web Accessibility checklist (http://www-3.ibm.com/able/guidelines/web/accessweb.html). When I test the help system running in infocenter mode using Bobby, it flags the tocView.jsp as failing checkpoint 1. Under checkpoint 1, images either need alt text to explain what they're for, or if the images don't carry significant information, then the alt needs to be set to "" (alt="") Bobby is flagging the icons used in the navigation (the closed book, open book, open page, unit page) as not having any alt defined. Because these icons do not convey significant information, the easiest way to comply with the Web Accessibility checklist on this item is to set the alt to "" for these icons. As passing the Web Accessibility checklist is critical to our teams currently deploying systems based on the 2.1.1 version of the help system, I'm requesting that any fix be made available as a patch to the 2.1.1 code, thank you!

Title: Making Eclipse Forms API
description:
This defect will be used to track the effort of reworking the current forms UI 
(a.k.a. flat UI) with following goal:

1) To make it API i.e. accessible to others (it is internal currently)
2) To move it away from PDE/Update into the more general name space
3) To carefully incorporate interesting extensions to the original code done 
by product teams

A proposal will be written as to what will be done. While the proposal is 
written, please comment on some of the basic proposal points:

- the new name of the plug-in would be 'Eclipse Forms'
- it would have an ID 'org.eclipse.ui.forms'
- it would be a part of the RCP workbench (having dependencies to JFace, 
editor code etc.) as an optional part of RCP offering.
- it would contain API and internal packages.
- API packages would be:
    org.eclipse.ui.forms - for classes that are used to assemble forms
    org.eclipse.ui.forms.parts - for building blocks like hyperlinks, 
collapsable sections etc.
    org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor - for code that hooks forms into multi-page 
editor part

Title: Improve sharing against an exisiting project
description:
As discussed in a separate thread: I feel there's a bit of a solidity issue 
with the CVS Client for general Sync usage and for Branching/ Merging.

When things go wrong, I've typically copied the source folders to a backup 
location. Indeed this is now my standard practice before any Branch/ Merge 
operations are attempted.

However, when a Merge fails and I wish to manually bring in work from a backed-
up source tree, there seems no operation to Connect my folders into CVS; 
without unwanted commits on *every* file.

Basically Eclipse seems to offers absolute 'Checkout', 'Replace' 
and 'Disconnect' operations, and what seems to be a relative 'Synchronize' 
operation, but no absolute 'Connect' operation.

Such an absolute operation would determine & correct Local & Remote states of 
all files, without reference to previous local CVS tags; providing the means to 
repair damaged states & giving 'operational completeness' of workspaces against 
CVS state.

... Having experimented somewhat with the CVS preferences, and having used the 
Sync Refresh with Remote option, I don't believe these are offer an 'Absolute' 
state operation.

They may or may not be close - I couldn't get much useful improvement out of 
the 'compare content' option - but complete Operability & Repair capability on 
the cvs state would require that I could specify, for some folder tree, what 
CVS revision I was installing my source folders into. Based on this it would 
determine changes with respect to that revision and retag files.

I've had to reengineer CVS sync & reintegrate changes manually a couple of 
times now. One 'window' for problems is to Merging from a branch, and then 
continuing work in that branch. The Merge operation does not create a new 
version or whatever tag to define the merged-from point, so further work will 
not be correctly mergable.

The Absolute 'Connect' operation would have been ideal for that situation, as 
it would be ideal for any and all situations where code has been worked on 
elsewhere, or restored from backup, or sync has been damaged, and any or all 
other problem situations. So I'd really be quite keen to see such a capability.

Title: templates in the Ant editor
description:
Add support for templates such as exist in JDT. Create a number of defaults for
fileheader, project, target with description, target without description,
macrodef, fileset, etc.

Title: outline and ant runner views should  include imported targets
description:
In handling an imported file (using the <import> task), the outline and ant
runner views should behave similarly as when entity includeds are used. 

The difficulty in implementing this, I am guessing, is that imports are probably
resolved at runtime rather than at parse time. A build file author might,
perhaps, use a property dereference to in the <import file=""/> declaration. To
accomediate this an action in the views could prompt the user with a dialog
allowing him to associate the import with a specific file in the file system.
This configuration detail could be saved in a comment in the build file itself
or else in some other configuration store.

Of course, we could handle direct file references now and code for property
dereferences in the import's file attribute later.

the action when a selected target does not support the feature (i.e. does not 
implement IStepFilters).

description: See bug 50174. 3.0 M6 While using the Plugin Registry view, i noticed that some extension points showed up with non-localized names. Perhaps missing resource translations should be logged to the platform log, as it indicates the programmer has forgotten to translate something. I got htis list by logging MREs in the BundelModel class. Here is a list of all the missing resource keys (and their plugin) that i could find: org.eclipse.team.ui %ActionSet.description

Title: [CoolBar] regression: Contributions being disposed in editor toolbar
description:
In M6, our toolbar is disappearing whenever a part other than the editorpart 
is active.  This never happened before.  It causes flashing and extra layouts 
of hte toolbar.  Also, our outline page retargets some of the editor's 
actions.  But now the actions aren't visible.

And, our custom contribution item's control is being disposed.  When disposed, 
it removes itself as a part listener, so when it is later recreated, it 
doesn't receive part notification.  Why are item's being disposed and then 
having fill(Toolbar) called again??

Title: CVS sync view becomes out-of-date
description:
McQ had an incident where he had outgoing changes that did not appear in the 
sync view. The view was in "both" mode and there was one incoming change 
visible but a comparison with the repository reveal 4 or 5 outgoing changes. 
The fact that the compare showed changes indicates tha the local sync states 
were correct but the sync view had not picked up the changes. This could be 
due to an event not getting through or, more likely, an incorrect clean 
indicator on a parent folder. He works disconnected on the weekend usign an 
external tool (Word) and does a refresh local to bring his changes into 
Eclipse.

changing the stacking order in the top right stack.

dynamically.  This can be done by adding a new "clonePerspective()" method on

some template perspective that is registered via the perspective extension 
point.

method as public API.

Title: API to know when a perspective reset finishes
description:
The IPerspectiveListener API currently fires a "reset" event when a perspective is about to be 
reset. However, there is not event to inform listeners when the reset is complete.

We would like a "resetComplete" notification because we have a part listener that we'd like to 
deregister during a reset. With the reset event, we know when to remove our listener. But we need 
the resetComplete to know when to add the listener back.

We need to do this for our view context support, which automatically opens/closes views for the 
user. In order to minimize disruptiveness, we don't automatically open/close a view that the user 
has manually opened or closed. We do this with a part listener. This mechanism currently catches 
views that are closed during a perspective reset, but we don't want it to.

Title: StyledText doesn't specify contents of its SelectionEvents
description:
StyledText offers to send out SelectionEvents, but I found no specification
about the contents of the SelectionEvent. SelectionEvent says that x and y
fields are Widget-specific, but doesn't link to StyledText.

StyledText#addSelectionListener(..) also doesn't specify the contents of the
SelectionEvent.

Looking at the implementation, I found that StyledText#sendSelectionEvent()
fills the Event.x and Event.y fields from the field StyledText#selection. At the
definition of this field, I found a wrong line comment, which reads...
  Point selection = new Point(0, 0);  // x is character offset, y is length
But when I look at the rest of the class, it seems as if
- x is the start character offset
- y is the offset of the next character after the selection (and NOT the length)

Therefore, I suggest:
- completing the Javadoc of StyledText#addSelectionListener()
- correcting the erroneous comment of field StyledText#selection
